thread.title: Claims lap dancing bar would 'compromise public safety' if open until 5am
thread.title_full: Claims lap dancing bar would 'compromise public safety' if open until 5am

author: David Humphreys
title: Claims lap dancing bar would 'compromise public safety' if open until 5am
text:
Cllr Nick Small has made his feelings clear on the venue hoping to open until the early hours Claims lap dancing bar would 'compromise public safety' if open until 5am
Dreamers lap dancing bar off Victoria Street
A lap dancing bar's bid to stay open until 5am would "compromise public safety" it has been claimed. It was revealed earlier this week how Dreamers on Victoria Street has lodged an application with Liverpool Council to extend its opening hours until the early hours of the morning.
The business has made a second attempt to keep its doors open later having initially been granted a sexual entertainment venue (SEV) licence in April 2023. However, this has prompted a backlash from a senior councillor representing the area in which the bar is located.
‌
Cllr Nick Small, Labour member for City Centre North, has issued an objection to the plans and is calling on Merseyside Police to oppose the proposals. Two years ago, the city council's licensing and gambling sub-committee signed off on an application by Meshach Harris to operate the gentleman's club until 2am.
‌
This came after a £150,000 refurbishment to provide for up to 80 patrons a night. Cllr Small has now released a letter indicating he would not back any extension of the terms.
He wrote: "I have…
David Humphreys
